Question 1 of 50 Question ID: 506113590

As a result of extensive training and development activities specified in the resource management plan, all of the teams working on the project perform at their best. However, as the project progresses, one of the teams sees substantial turnover. You realize that the team will need specific training and coaching to align its performance with the rest of the teams.

What is the best approach for you to take in this situation?

A
B
C
D

Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

The scenario implies the project manager is carrying out the Develop Team process. Individual and team assessments are one of the tools and techniques that can be used during this process. Team performance assessments are an output of this process. The best way to measure team performance is by assessment. In this case, individual and team assessments should be given to the team that experienced high turnover to ensure that you can most effectively target any shortcomings. It will not be useful to base your adjustments on past performance, because, as a result of the significant turnover described in the question, a substantial part of the team consists of new members.



Details for Each Option:

A

Correct. By conducting team evaluations, the project manager can determine the specific training, coaching, and mentoring needs of the team members. Without this assessment, the project manager can only guess at the needs of the team.

B

Incorrect. It is wasteful to repeat the entire training regime when more targeted and focused efforts may be all that is required. Additionally, repeating training can be demotivating for many high-performing individuals.

C

Incorrect. Although work performance reports can give insight into team performance for work already conducted, they cannot identify specific needs for upcoming work where no work performance information yet exists.

D

Incorrect. According to the scenario, the resource management plan has already been reviewed. While the plan may provide guidance, it cannot identify the specific needs of the team members, especially when these team members are new to the organization and were not even identified at the time the resource management plan was in development.

Exam Content Outline:

Domain: 1. People
Task: 1.5 Ensure team members/stakeholders are adequately trained
PM Approach: Predictive

+Reference:

A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.6 DEMONSTRATE LEADERSHIP BEHAVIORS

      Question 2 of 50 Question ID: 506112723

      You are leading a project to develop a product that will be sold through an existing nationwide dealer network. The product will be built incrementally by a virtual team, while the dealer training and product rollout processes will be well-defined upfront. You want the dealers to provide the team with regular feedback throughout product development.

      What is the best strategy to achieve your goal?

      A
      B
      C
      D

      Correct Answer: C

      Explanation:

      The scenario indicates that the product development phase of the project will follow an incremental project lifecycle, and suggests that the dealer training and product rollout will take a predictive approach. This situation implies that the project, as a whole, will adopt a hybrid project management framework. With the product development phase following an incremental model, the product increments can be released as they are completed. In this situation, a product demonstration should be conducted once the product increment has been developed. Having the dealers attend the product demonstrations virtually will allow the dealers to view the product increment and provide their feedback while minimizing the impact on the dealer's regular responsibilities.



      Details for Each Option:

      A

      Incorrect. An iteration retrospective is a meeting aimed to learn about, improve, and adapt the process the team uses to develop the product/service of the project. Those meetings are not used to obtain feedback for the product.

      B

      Incorrect. Collecting comprehensive requirements upfront and developing a detailed WBS for the product should be done when using a predictive project management framework. However, the scenario stipulates that the product will be developed using an incremental project lifecycle. Therefore, requirements and scope will be progressively elaborated rather than planned in advance.

      C

      Correct. Since the team is virtual and the dealers are dispersed nationwide, virtual tools will be needed for collaboration. Having the dealers attend the product demonstrations virtually would allow the dealers to provide feedback with minimal disruption to their regular duties.

      D

      Incorrect. Colocating the dealers with the development team would certainly enhance collaboration and provide maximum opportunity for the dealers to provide feedback to the development team. However, it is unclear as to how realistic and beneficial would it be to remove the dealers from their locations for the duration of the project and colocate them with some of the development team members who are also not colocated as a team.

      Exam Content Outline:

      Domain: 1. People
      Task: 1.11 Engage and support virtual teams
      PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

      +Reference:

      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 3.3.1 LIFE CYCLE AND DEVELOPMENT APPROACH SELECTION
      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 3.3.2 PROCESSES
      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 3.3.3 ENGAGEMENT
      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 3.3.4 TOOLS
      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 3.3.5 METHODS AND ARTIFACTS
      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 3.4.3 TAILOR FOR THE PROJECT

          Question 3 of 50 Question ID: 506112822

          The project management plan for a two-phase project indicates that market research will employ a predictive approach, and product development will follow an agile model. The project team has just completed the market research phase and is about to transition to the product development phase, which is characterized by a strict budget and schedule.

          What leadership style is best for the project manager to adopt for the product development phase?

          A
          B
          C
          D

          Correct Answer: C

          Explanation:

          The scenario describes a hybrid project incorporating predictive and agile phases. A project manager may need to adjust their leadership style based on many factors, including the organizational framework. In this case, the project will transition from traditional waterfall to an agile model. When employing a predictive framework, the activities needed to complete the project are planned and assigned in advance. This top-down approach requires a more directive leadership style to ensure that what has been planned is carried out according to the plan. When using agile methodologies, the project team collaborates to complete the project objectives. Agile teams thrive under servant leadership, and the project manager will need to support the team's collaboration rather than direct their activities. Therefore, in this scenario, the project manager will need to move away from a directive leadership style and adopt a servant leadership approach.



          Details for Each Option:

          A

          Incorrect. Directive leadership style best works for projects (phases) that are managed using a predictive project management approach. According to the scenario, the product development phase will utilize agile. Teams that carry out their work using agile practices perform better with servant rather than directive leaders.

          B

          Incorrect. The Laissez-faire leadership style is a hands-off approach that allows the team to make their own decision and set their own goals. While this answer choice sounds like a plausible option, allowing the team to set their own goals may conflict with the strict budget and schedule established for the second phase, as described by the scenario.

          C

          Correct. The project manager will likely need to transition from a directive leadership style to a servant leader approach. Agile teams thrive under servant leadership, and, since the project is transitioning from predictive to an agile model, servant leadership would be the most appropriate leadership style.

          D

          Incorrect. Smoothing (accommodating) is a conflict resolution technique rather than a leadership style.

          Exam Content Outline:

          Domain: 1. People
          Task: 1.2 Lead a team
          PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

          +Reference:

          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.6 DEMONSTRATE LEADERSHIP BEHAVIORS
          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.1 PROJECT TEAM MANAGEMENT AND LEADERSHIP
          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.1.2 Distributed Management and Leadership
          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.4 LEADERSHIP SKILLS
          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.5 TAILORING LEADERSHIP STYLES
          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.2.1 SITUATIONAL LEADERSHIP MODELS
          Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.2 SERVANT LEADERSHIP EMPOWERS THE TEAM
          Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 3.3.1 Leadership Styles
          End Exam

              Question 4 of 50 Question ID: 506150708

              The product owner for an agile project has another project at the same time. As a result, the product owner spends very little time with the development team and the product is suffering.

              What should an agile practitioner on this team do first?

              A
              B
              C
              D

              Correct Answer: A

              Explanation:

              The product owner has quite a bit of responsibility as the stakeholder representative. To increase the chances of the project's success, the product owner needs to be involved in the project. Agile practitioners advocate for agile principles by modeling them and discussing agile values in order to develop a shared mindset across the team as well as between the customer and the team.

              One may argue that since the product owner cannot attend every meeting even after being coached by the agile practitioner, escalating the issue to the project sponsor or asking for a new product owner could be a better choice. While this is true, the question is asking "What should an agile practitioner do first?". The emphasis is on 'first'. Explaining to the product owner the importance of participating in team events should be the best 'first' step for the agile practitioner to take. If this does not address the issue, then escalating the issue or requesting a replacement could be the next step after coaching.



              Details for Each Option:

              A

              Correct. The product owner plays a critical role in an Agile project, acting as the voice of the customer and driving product development. As such, their active participation in team events, such as sprint reviews and planning meetings, is essential for ensuring the team has a clear understanding of the product vision and customer needs. By coaching the product owner on the importance of their participation, the Agile practitioner can help improve communication and collaboration within the team, ultimately leading to a better product and project success.

              B

              Incorrect. While the sponsor may be able to help in this scenario, this choice is not the first action to be taken to resolve the issue. Coaching the product owner on the importance of participating in team events would be a better choice. Sponsors should only be involved as a last resort.

              C

              Incorrect. The agile product owner is the project's key stakeholder. The product owner has a vision of the product that is being developed by the team. Replacing the product owner should not be the first action.

              D

              Incorrect. Although it's true that Agile encourages team members to become generalizing specialists to reduce team size and bottlenecks, this approach is mainly applied for the development team members, such as the developers, the testers, and so on. The scrum master typically does not have a firm grasp on the product vision and may even have conflicting interests with the product owner, and therefore would not be the best candidate for this role.

              Exam Content Outline:

              Domain: 1. People
              Task: 1.13 Mentor relevant stakeholders
              PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

              +Reference:

              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.3 EFFECTIVELY ENGAGE WITH STAKEHOLDERS
              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.1.1.4 Engage
              Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.3.2 AGILE ROLES
              Coaching Agile Teams: A Companion for ScrumMasters, Agile Coaches, and Project Managers in Transition, Lyssa Adkins, 2010, Coaching Product Owners on Being a Good Product Owner for the Team
              End Exam

                  Question 5 of 50 Question ID: 506150604

                  During the team's daily stand-up meeting, two of the team members are arguing about how to solve an issue that is delaying development of one of the modules.

                  What is the best course of action for the agile coach to take?

                  A
                  B
                  C
                  D

                  Correct Answer: D

                  Explanation:

                  Agile teams are self-directing, self-organizing, and are empowered to make decisions regarding their own work. Agile methods encourage constructive disagreement, and the team members need to learn to work out disagreements without outside influence. However, a daily stand-up meeting is a time-boxed event with a very clear agenda. Three questions are addressed on the daily stand-up meeting by the team members who have tasks: What have I done since the last daily stand-up meeting? What am I planning to do today? Are there any impediments to my progress? The stand-up meeting is not the forum for the rest of the team to render their opinions and let the majority rule (or any other rule agreed upon by the team) to remove the impediment. Such discussions should take place outside the daily stand-up meeting. Therefore, the best course of action for the agile coach to take would be to remind the team members that the daily stand-up is not the forum to discuss such things.



                  Details for Each Option:

                  A

                  Incorrect. While agile methods do encourage constructive disagreement, is the role of the agile coach to educate and encourage the team to use agile best practices, so it is important for the coach to speak up about the goal and format for the daily stand-up meeting.

                  B

                  Incorrect. While agile methods do encourage team members to work out disagreements on their own, it is important for the coach to remind the team about the goal and format for the daily stand-up meeting.

                  C

                  Incorrect. Majority rule may well be how the team decides to resolve the issue. However, the daily stand-up is not the right forum for discussing or voting on the issue.

                  D

                  Correct. The coach should remind the team members of what should be discussed in the daily stand-up meeting and encourage the team to set aside time outside of the daily stand-up to discuss and resolve the issue.

                  Exam Content Outline:

                  Domain: 1. People
                  Task: 1.1 Manage conflict
                  PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                  +Reference:

                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.6 DEMONSTRATE LEADERSHIP BEHAVIORS
                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.1 PROJECT TEAM MANAGEMENT AND LEADERSHIP
                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.4.3 MEETINGS AND EVENTS
                  Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 5.2.4 DAILY STANDUPS
                  Additional resources: https://www.scrumguides.org/scrum-guide.html
                  End Exam

                      Question 6 of 50 Question ID: 506150712

                      An agile coach notices that the team is not engaged in the daily standup meetings. Some seem disinterested, while others are checking their cell phones during the meetings.

                      What should the agile coach do?

                      A
                      B
                      C
                      D

                      Correct Answer: A

                      Explanation:

                      An agile coach should get the team members involved in the project in order to be successful. Agile practitioners advocate for agile principles by modeling them and discussing agile values in order to develop a shared mindset across the team as well as between the customer and the team.



                      Details for Each Option:

                      A

                      Correct. Team members need to be educated on the importance of participating with their teammates during the daily standup meeting. This meeting allows others to gain a feel for their teammates' progress and the issues they might have encountered.

                      B

                      Incorrect. The agile coach should first try to resolve the issue with the relevant team members before escalating it to the project sponsor.

                      C

                      Incorrect. This choice is the last option to be considered. Simply coaching the team members on agile principles should be enough to resolve the situation.

                      D

                      Incorrect. Daily standup meeting is a time-boxed event typically limited to 15 minutes and is not intended to discuss team members who are not engaged in the daily standup meetings.

                      Exam Content Outline:

                      Domain: 1. People
                      Task: 1.13 Mentor relevant stakeholders
                      PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                      +Reference:

                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.4.3 MEETINGS AND EVENTS
                      Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.2.1.3 SERVANT LEADERS PAVE THE WAY FOR OTHERS' CONTRIBUTION
                      Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.2.1.4 CONSIDER THESE SERVANT LEADER RESPONSIBILITIES
                      Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 5.2.4 DAILY STANDUPS
                      Agile Software Development: The Cooperative Game, Second Edition, Alistair Cockburn, 2007, Daily Standup Meeting
                      End Exam

                          Question 7 of 50 Question ID: 506113844

                          An agile team is trying to determine the ideal iteration length. The team members are having a long and intense argument about it, but no one is willing to compromise. The scrum master is called in to help resolve the conflict.

                          What is the best course of action for a scrum master?

                          A
                          B
                          C
                          D

                          Correct Answer: B

                          Explanation:

                          When the intensity of an argument reaches a point where a positive outcome is unlikely, the scrum master should use the opportunity to coach the team towards an effective and productive solution. An effective and skilled scrum master can accomplish this without 'managing' the team. The scrum master should help by using facilitation and coaching. This facilitation can involve getting the entire team together to come to a consensus on the most appropriate iteration length or helping to create a safe environment for the team members to have the discussion. For example, the scrum master could suggest the team members discuss the pros and cons of each suggested iteration length to help the team reach a consensus.



                          Details for Each Option:

                          A

                          Incorrect. According to the scenario, the argument between the team members is intense, with little chance to reach a consensus, warranting the involvement of the scrum master. Avoiding being involved in the process would unlikely help in achieving a positive outcome.

                          B

                          Correct. When an argument reaches an impasse, and a positive outcome is unlikely, the scrum master should facilitate the discussion between the involved parties so they can reach an agreement. Providing the pros and cons of each one of the suggested iteration lengths would likely soften the tension and bring the discussion down to a reasonable level.

                          C

                          Incorrect. It is quite evident that threatening the team members with disciplinary actions if they are unable to come to an agreement is not the best course of action for any manager/leader, especially on agile projects. This answer choice can be eliminated as being unreasonable and seen as over-reaction.

                          D

                          Incorrect. Agile teams are self-organizing and self-directing and must be able to decide on the iteration length. At times, when the situation warrants so, an external "force" such as a scrum master may step in and make the decision for the team. However, according to the scenario, the discussion has not (yet) reached the level of conflict where there is a risk of relationships to be damaged that would warrant the intervention of an outside party.

                          Exam Content Outline:

                          Domain: 1. People
                          Task: 1.1 Manage conflict
                          PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                          +Reference:

                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.2 CREATE A COLLABORATIVE PROJECT TEAM ENVIRONMENT
                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.6 DEMONSTRATE LEADERSHIP BEHAVIORS
                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.1 PROJECT TEAM MANAGEMENT AND LEADERSHIP
                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.1.2 Distributed Management and Leadership
                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.5 TAILORING LEADERSHIP STYLES
                          Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, A3.2 SCRUM
                          Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 3.3.1 Leadership Styles
                          Agile Project Management: Creating Innovative Products, Second Edition, Jim Highsmith, 2009, Building Agile Teams - Self-Organization
                          End Exam

                              Question 8 of 50 Question ID: 507000005

                              To shorten the project duration from 15 to 11 sprints without reducing the project backlog, the project sponsor suggests hiring an additional developer urgently. However, developers familiar with the programming language used on the project are in very short supply. The scrum master believes that her brother is qualified for the role and is available immediately.

                              Considering no other options are available, what should the scrum master do?

                              A
                              B
                              C
                              D

                              Correct Answer: A

                              Explanation:

                              Networking is a common practice for organizations to acquire talent. In many cases, organizations offer incentives for employees to refer their friends and family members for job openings. However, having personal and familial relationships in the workplace can result in potential conflicts of interest, especially when relatives work in the same team or project, as is the case in the scenario described (assuming the scrum master's brother will be hired). The organization's policies and procedures typically cover how these potential conflicts of interest should be managed or avoided. In this scenario, the project sponsor might consider hiring the scrum master's brother as a quick solution to complete the project sooner. Being a diligent, respectful, and caring steward are one of the project management principles. Stewardship requires leadership with transparency and trustworthiness. Hence, the scrum master can recommend the brother as an option for the project sponsor to consider but must also maintain transparency by disclosing the familial relationship. The onus will then be placed on the project sponsor to decide how best to proceed without any bias.



                              Details for Each Option:

                              A

                              Correct. Since a potential conflict of interest exists in this scenario, being transparent is an essential duty of project leaders as diligent, respectful, and caring stewards. Making the recommendation and disclosing the familial relationship places the onus on the project sponsor to make the best decision for the organization without being biased.

                              B

                              Incorrect. Personal and familial relationships are not uncommon within organizations. Typically, the organization's policies and procedures specify how these types of potential conflicts of interest are to be addressed. Avoiding all personal and familial relationships within an organization might result in missed opportunities to acquire the best talent.

                              C

                              Incorrect. This course of action goes against the principle of transparency and trustworthiness, which are essential to effective project management. By asking the sponsor to keep the familial relationship quiet, the scrum master is hiding information from the rest of the team, which can create resentment and damage team morale.

                              D

                              Incorrect. From the scenario provided, it is unclear whether or not the scrum master has the authority to hire new team members. Even if we assume that the scrum master does have hiring authority, hiring her brother without first disclosing the relationship would lack transparency and undermine the trustworthiness of the scrum master.

                              Exam Content Outline:

                              Domain: 1. People
                              Task: 1.6 Build a team
                              PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                              +Reference:

                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.1 BE A DILIGENT, RESPECTFUL, AND CARING STEWARD
                              End Exam

                                  Question 9 of 50 Question ID: 506113726

                                  One of your project team members indicates that she is missing some project communications due to being left off of a group email distribution list. You document the problem and assign it to a responsible party. The following week the team member asks you for an update.

                                  What document should you check to find the name of the responsible party and a target date for resolution?

                                  A
                                  B
                                  C
                                  D

                                  Correct Answer: D

                                  Explanation:

                                  The issue log is a project document that can serve as an input to the Manage Team process. This document is used to record and monitor who is responsible for resolving specific issues and includes a target date for resolution. Therefore, the issue log is the document where you should find the name of the owner of a particular issue along with a target date for resolution.



                                  Details for Each Option:

                                  A

                                  Incorrect. A RACI chart is a type of responsibility assignment matrix which defines the involvement of stakeholders in project activities. It does not contain information on specific issues.

                                  B

                                  Incorrect. A responsibility assignment matrix (RAM) is a grid that shows the project resources assigned to each work package. It does not contain information on specific issues.

                                  C

                                  Incorrect. The project team directory documents the names, project roles, and contact information for members of the project team. It does not contain information on specific issues.

                                  D

                                  Correct. An issue log is used to document and monitor who is responsible for resolving specific issues and includes a target date for resolution.

                                  Exam Content Outline:

                                  Domain: 2. Process
                                  Task: 2.15 Manage project issues
                                  PM Approach: Predictive

                                  +Reference:

                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.5.4 PROJECT COMMUNICATIONS AND ENGAGEMENT
                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.6.2 LOGS AND REGISTERS
                                  Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 5.15 Plan Resource Management
                                  Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.1 Direct and Manage Project Work
                                  Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 9 Inputs and Outputs

                                      Question 10 of 50 Question ID: 506112713

                                      A new smartphone will be developed by two teams: a hardware team that will use a predictive project management approach and a software team that will use an agile framework. Each team is colocated but resides in two different parts of the country. The teams will need to coordinate their activities very closely, but bringing them together in one location is not an option.

                                      What should the project manager do to create the most collaborative environment?

                                      A
                                      B
                                      C
                                      D

                                      Correct Answer: B

                                      Explanation:

                                      The scenario describes a project that is being managed using a hybrid approach by combining agile and predictive frameworks within the same project. Specifically, in this case, the software development team will use an agile framework, and the hardware development team will use a predictive approach. Regardless of the project management frameworks, the two teams will need to coordinate their efforts to build the final product closely. The ideal approach would be to colocate both teams in the same physical location, but the scenario stipulates that this is not an option. Therefore, the project manager can recreate physical colocation in a virtual environment with the use of a fishbowl window. This approach will allow the project teams to gain most of the benefits of colocation even though they are physically dispersed. The incorrect answer choices represent actions that would not likely enhance collaboration between the two groups.



                                      Details for Each Option:

                                      A

                                      Incorrect. Blended agile is structured by combining two or more agile frameworks, elements, or practices. In this scenario, the software team, which is using an agile framework, might or might not use a blended agile approach, but there is not enough information presented to make this determination. More importantly, using a blended agile approach for software development would not likely enhance collaboration with the hardware development team.

                                      B

                                      Correct. A fishbowl window is created by setting up long-lived video conferencing links to connect dispersed teams in a virtual environment. Using a fishbowl window will bring the two development teams together in a virtual environment to enhance collaboration.

                                      C

                                      Incorrect. According to the scenario, the hardware team will use a predictive project management approach. While theoretically transitioning the team to agile is possible, it is unclear if this action would improve the collaboration between the two teams. The two teams will still need to coordinate their efforts regardless of the project management framework used by each.

                                      D

                                      Incorrect. Caves and common can be set up by creating a common area for development work and also providing offices when individual team members need to work privately. This approach might be used by a colocated team to enhance collaboration and productivity. However, this strategy would not likely enhance collaboration between the two geographically separated development teams.

                                      Exam Content Outline:

                                      Domain: 1. People
                                      Task: 1.11 Engage and support virtual teams
                                      PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                      +Reference:

                                      Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.3.6 TEAM WORKSPACES
                                      The Software Project Manager's Bridge to Agility, Michele Sliger, Stacia Broderick, 2008, We Aren't Co-located, So We Can't Be Agile
                                      End Exam

                                          Question 11 of 50 Question ID: 506113409

                                          One of the project manager's key responsibilities is to motivate the project team to achieve maximum productivity and increase the probability of project success.

                                          In this respect, according to Maslow's hierarchy of needs, which of the below is most correct?

                                          A
                                          B
                                          C
                                          D

                                          Correct Answer: A

                                          Explanation:

                                          The question refers to organizational theories which should be considered as part of the Plan Resource Management process. Organizational theory provides information about how people, teams, and organizational units behave - in this case, the project team. While all answer choices represent various organizational theories, only one describes Maslow's theory of human motivation. Psychologist Abraham Maslow grouped motivational factors into a hierarchy, with physiological needs such as air, food, water, and sleep at the lowest and most fundamental level. He argued that these essential needs must be met before people can be motivated by higher-order factors, such as financial security, recognition, and social acceptance. In order to best motivate the project team, it is important to ensure that basic needs are indeed met, such as ensuring a standard work schedule and providing reasonable working conditions.

                                          The topic of this question is only briefly mentioned in the PMBOK® Guide. However, the Project Management Professional (PMP)® Examination Content Outline (ECO) indicates that while there are some commonalities between the PMBOK® Guide and the ECO, the exam is not bound by the PMBOK® Guide. The list of enablers specified in the tasks of the ECO domains is not exhaustive either. The ECO assumes that prospective PMP aspirants are familiar with other sources of information/preparation, including but not limited to the PMI Code of Ethics and Professional Conduct, PMI's Practice Standards (e.g., Scheduling, Earned Value Management, etc.), commonly frowned upon project management practices, such as gold plating, and others. We intentionally have these questions in our simulator so that you would be better prepared for the real exam. PMP aspirants are encouraged to explore additional sources of information and/or to be familiar with them from their project management experience.



                                          Details for Each Option:

                                          A

                                          Correct. Abraham Maslow grouped motivational factors into a hierarchy, with physiological needs such as air, food, and water at the lowest and most fundamental level. Once these essential needs are met, then people are motivated by higher order factors, such as financial security, recognition, and social acceptance.

                                          B

                                          Incorrect. This answer choice describes McGregor's theory of X and Y.

                                          C

                                          Incorrect. This answer choice refers to Herzberg's motivation-hygiene theory.

                                          D

                                          Incorrect. This is McClelland's theory of needs.

                                          Exam Content Outline:

                                          Domain: 1. People
                                          Task: 1.2 Lead a team
                                          PM Approach: Predictive

                                          +Reference:

                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.2 CREATE A COLLABORATIVE PROJECT TEAM ENVIRONMENT
                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.6 DEMONSTRATE LEADERSHIP BEHAVIORS
                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.1 PROJECT TEAM MANAGEMENT AND LEADERSHIP
                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.2.3 MOTIVATION MODELS
                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.2.3.1 Hygiene and Motivational Factors
                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.2.3.2 Intrinsic versus Extrinsic Motivation
                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.2.3.3 Theory of Needs

                                              Question 12 of 50 Question ID: 506112487

                                              After gaining a clear understanding of the problem, a senior manager suggests to a newly promoted project manager that she should emphasize areas of agreement rather than areas of difference when handling the current conflict issues within the team.

                                              Which conflict resolution technique is the mentor recommending?

                                              A
                                              B
                                              C
                                              D

                                              Correct Answer: A

                                              Explanation:

                                              The smooth/accommodate conflict resolution technique emphasizes areas of agreement rather than areas of difference; conceding one's position to the needs of others to maintain harmony and relationships. The mentor's response is the definition of the smooth/accommodate conflict resolution technique.



                                              Details for Each Option:

                                              A

                                              Correct. The smooth/accommodate conflict resolution technique emphasizes areas of agreement rather than areas of difference; conceding one's position to the needs of others to maintain harmony and relationships.

                                              B

                                              Incorrect. The compromise/reconcile technique seeks to find solutions that bring some degree of satisfaction to all parties to temporarily or partially resolve the conflict. This approach occasionally results in a lose-lose situation.

                                              C

                                              Incorrect. The force/direct technique involves pushing one's viewpoint at the expense of others. This approach is usually enforced through a power position to resolve an emergency and often results in a win-lose situation.

                                              D

                                              Incorrect. The collaborate/problem solve technique incorporates multiple viewpoints and insights from differing perspectives and requires a cooperative attitude and open dialogue that typically leads to consensus and commitment. This approach can result in a win-win situation.

                                              Exam Content Outline:

                                              Domain: 1. People
                                              Task: 1.1 Manage conflict
                                              PM Approach: Predictive

                                              +Reference:

                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.4.4 Interpersonal Skills
                                              Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.6 Manage Team
                                              Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 10 Tools and Techniques

                                                  Question 13 of 50 Question ID: 506112323

                                                  The project manager is having difficulty with recurring conflict among team members who are self-driven experts in their field. He is looking for an appropriate way to manage them and calls them to a meeting. He gathers differing perspectives from each team member and through open dialogue builds consensus and commitment.

                                                  What conflict management technique has the project manager used in this situation?

                                                  A
                                                  B
                                                  C
                                                  D

                                                  Correct Answer: D

                                                  Explanation:

                                                  The project manager is using collaboration by incorporating multiple viewpoints and insights from the differing perspectives through open dialogue to gain consensus and build commitment. This approach can result in a win-win situation. Of the available answer choices, collaborating is the best description of the conflict management technique used by the project manager.



                                                  Details for Each Option:

                                                  A

                                                  Incorrect. The project manager took an active role in addressing the issue by conducting a meeting, rather than withdrawing from the problem.

                                                  B

                                                  Incorrect. Compromising is characterized by each side of a dispute making concessions which bring some satisfaction to all parties to temporarily or partially resolve the conflict. There is no indication from the question that any concessions have been made to support this answer choice.

                                                  C

                                                  Incorrect. Forcing involves pushing one's viewpoint at the expense of others, which is inconsistent with the question's characterization of building consensus among the team members.

                                                  D

                                                  Correct. Collaborating incorporates multiple viewpoints and insights from the differing perspectives through open dialogue that typically leads to consensus and commitment.

                                                  Task: 1.1 Manage conflict

                                                      Question 14 of 50 Question ID: 506112802

                                                      An internal project will deliver a new tool to the performing organization for use by its employees. The project team wants to use short development cycles to gain early feedback and manage the high rate of change coming from the employees. The training manager, on the other hand, insists on creating a detailed training plan upfront to train the employees.

                                                      What is the best way for the project manager to resolve the conflict?

                                                      A
                                                      B
                                                      C
                                                      D

                                                      Correct Answer: C

                                                      Explanation:

                                                      The scenario describes a conflict regarding the best project management framework for the project. Product development would be best served with an agile approach to provide early feedback and manage the high rate of change. However, the training manager's aspect of the project would be better suited to a predictive approach. Since the product development and the training represent two distinct stages of the project, there is no reason to force a specific approach to both stages. Each stage can adopt the project management framework that is best suited to it. Providing a compromise by adopting an agile framework for product development and a predictive model for the training should resolve the conflict and provide the best overall approach for the project.

                                                      It should be noted that the use of the compromise/reconcile conflict management technique suggests that each side is giving something up, which is not clear in this case. If by adopting the hybrid project management approach, neither party is making any sacrifice, then the collaborate/problem solve conflict resolution technique might better describe the resolution. However, from the scenario described, it cannot be determined whether or not both sides are giving anything up. Since the collaborate/problem solve technique was not offered as an answer choice, compromising is the best answer from the available options.



                                                      Details for Each Option:

                                                      A

                                                      Incorrect. Project managers should attempt to resolve conflicts before escalating to the project sponsor. The project manager, assuming it's not her first project, should rely on her experience to determine the appropriate project management framework. The project manager can then submit the recommendations to the project sponsor for approval, if necessary.

                                                      B

                                                      Incorrect. Emphasizing the commonalities between both approaches is an example that partially describes the smooth/accommodate conflict resolution technique. However, merely emphasizing the commonalities would not resolve the conflict. The project manager still needs to determine the best approach for the project to address the issue described.

                                                      C

                                                      Correct. Using an agile approach for product development and then a predictive approach for training should resolve the conflict. The hybrid approach is the logical choice based on the limited information provided in the scenario.

                                                      D

                                                      Incorrect. This answer choice describes the force/direct conflict resolution technique. This technique is typically used in extreme situations, which is not the case described in the scenario. Forcing a specific approach simply to satisfy one party is not the best course of action.

                                                      Exam Content Outline:

                                                      Domain: 1. People
                                                      Task: 1.1 Manage conflict
                                                      PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                      +Reference:

                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 2.3.3 FACILITATE AND SUPPORT
                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.2 CREATE A COLLABORATIVE PROJECT TEAM ENVIRONMENT
                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.4.4 Interpersonal Skills
                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.2.7.1 Conflict Model
                                                      Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.6 Manage Team
                                                      Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 10 Tools and Techniques
                                                      Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 3.1.6 CHARACTERISTICS OF HYBRID LIFE CYCLES
                                                      Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 3.1.7 COMBINED AGILE AND PREDICTIVE APPROACHES
                                                      End Exam

                                                          Question 15 of 50 Question ID: 506112602

                                                          An agile coach has been assigned to a newly formed team with their first project. The coach colocated the team, provided training on agile best practices, and explained that agile teams are self-managing. However, the team members are struggling to assign user stories from the Kanban board, and productivity is suffering as a result of the lack of collaboration.

                                                          What is the best course of action for the agile coach?

                                                          A
                                                          B
                                                          C
                                                          D

                                                          Correct Answer: D

                                                          Explanation:

                                                          According to the Tuckman ladder model of team development, a newly formed project team will start in the forming stage. During this stage, the team members are still learning their role within the team and how to collaborate with one another. In this scenario, the project team is in the forming stage and may not be capable of self-management at the onset of the project. The agile coach may need to adopt a more directive leadership style for the first sprint or two and then transition to a more supportive leadership approach once the team begins to coalesce.



                                                          Details for Each Option:

                                                          A

                                                          Incorrect. Ideally, agile teams are self-managing. However, a newly formed team may not be capable of effective self-management in the beginning. Additionally, ignoring any problem with the project or project team is not likely to be the correct answer. At a minimum, the agile coach should monitor the situation to determine what action to take, if any.

                                                          B

                                                          Incorrect. The agile coach may need to assign tasks to individual team members while the team is in the forming stage. However, as the team develops and collaboration improves, the coach should transition from directive to a supportive leadership style. Thus, assigning the user stories to individual team members from now onward is an overreaction.

                                                          C

                                                          Incorrect. The project team may or may not benefit from updating the team charter in this situation. However, the team charter will be most effective when it is developed by the project team members, or when they are at least given the opportunity to contribute to it. Working agreements from a different team may not be particularly relevant to this team.

                                                          D

                                                          Correct. A newly formed project team may not be capable of self-management at the outset. The agile coach may need to adopt a more directive leadership style while the team is in the forming stage, which is the stage implied by the scenario.

                                                          Exam Content Outline:

                                                          Domain: 1. People
                                                          Task: 1.2 Lead a team
                                                          PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                          +Reference:

                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.2 CREATE A COLLABORATIVE PROJECT TEAM ENVIRONMENT
                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.2.6 PROJECT TEAM DEVELOPMENT MODELS
                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.2.6.1 Tuckman Ladder
                                                          Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.5 Develop Team
                                                          End Exam

                                                              Question 16 of 50 Question ID: 508115033

                                                              A multinational project team is developing a new cloud-based regulatory compliance system. Two senior architects are in conflict: one insists on using a proven predictive approach to ensure compliance with strict government regulations, while the other advocates for an agile approach to quickly adapt to evolving stakeholder requirements. Their escalating dispute has begun delaying critical design decisions, creating tension across the global team.

                                                              As the project manager, what is the most appropriate conflict resolution strategy to recommend and reconcile this situation?

                                                              A
                                                              B
                                                              C
                                                              D

                                                              Correct Answer: B

                                                              Explanation:

                                                              What kind of conflict is this? Substantive: disagreement about delivery approach (predictive vs. agile). Relationship: tension between two senior architects affecting the wider team. Structural/Contextual: high-stakes regulatory environment + evolving stakeholder needs + global distribution. This calls for collaborative/problem-solving (interest-based) rather than force/compromise/escalate. You need a solution that reduces risk and preserves adaptability.

                                                              Recommendation is reconcile in action: you evaluate constraints and interests, recommend a criteria-driven hybrid, and reconcile by gaining agreement and establishing governance and measures—resolving the conflict and protecting both value and compliance.



                                                              Details for Each Option:

                                                              A

                                                              Incorrect because it dismisses adaptability needs, undermines stakeholder engagement, and risks misalignment with evolving requirements. This is a forcing strategy, not reconciliation.

                                                              B

                                                              This is correct because the project manager must evaluate and reconcile the conflict by integrating both perspectives into a hybrid approach. Regulatory compliance demands predictive elements, but stakeholder adaptation benefits from agile practices. Facilitating structured dialogue not only resolves the conflict but also builds trust, aligns the solution with project objectives, and reduces risks.

                                                              C

                                                              Incorrect because escalation should be a last resort. The project manager is responsible for conflict resolution first (ECO Task 1).

                                                              D

                                                              Incorrect because it is an arbitrary compromise. Without evaluating requirements, this could create inefficiency and regulatory gaps.

                                                              Exam Content Outline:

                                                              Domain: 1. People
                                                              Task: 1.1 Manage conflict
                                                              PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                              +Reference:

                                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.7 TAILOR BASED ON CONTEXT
                                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.3 EFFECTIVELY ENGAGE WITH STAKEHOLDERS
                                                              Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.6 Manage Team
                                                              Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.10 Manage Stakeholder Engagement
                                                              Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.2.1.1 SERVANT LEADERS FACILITATE
                                                              End Exam

                                                                  Question 17 of 50 Question ID: 506151142

                                                                  Which leadership behavior is emphasized in an agile environment compared to projects carried out using a traditional project management approach?

                                                                  A
                                                                  B
                                                                  C
                                                                  D

                                                                  Correct Answer: A

                                                                  Explanation:

                                                                  Agile project management approach emphasizes servant leadership as a way to empower teams. Unlike traditional managers, agile leaders encourage their teams to be self-organizing, self-directing, and empowered to make their own decisions. In other words, agile leaders enable their team members to act upon decisions the teams are making. Managers in an agile environment practice servant leadership by supporting and encouraging others in their endeavors so that they can perform at their highest level and continue to improve.



                                                                  Details for Each Option:

                                                                  A

                                                                  Correct. Agile managers are servant leaders who lead through service to the team by focusing on understanding and addressing the needs and the development of team members in order to enable the highest possible team performance.

                                                                  B

                                                                  Incorrect. Solving problems for the team is more typical of a traditional manager than an agile leader. Agile encourages its leaders to empower teams to solve problems for themselves. If the team members, after several attempts, are unable to find a solution, an agile leader may consider stepping in and help.

                                                                  C

                                                                  Incorrect. A working agreement is a set of rules by which team members operate. For example, the team can establish the criteria for what "done" means to judge the completeness of a product increment; the team can decide to use the work-in-progress (WIP) limits, respect the timebox, etc. The main point here is that it is the team members, not agile leaders, who create working agreements.

                                                                  D

                                                                  Incorrect. Both agile and traditional managers have to handle uncertainties and risks. Therefore, this choice does not describe how agile leaders differ from traditional managers.

                                                                  Exam Content Outline:

                                                                  Domain: 1. People
                                                                  Task: 1.4 Empower team members and stakeholders
                                                                  PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                  +Reference:

                                                                  Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.1 START WITH AN AGILE MINDSET
                                                                  Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.2 SERVANT LEADERSHIP EMPOWERS THE TEAM
                                                                  Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.2.1 SERVANT LEADER RESPONSIBILITIES
                                                                  Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.2.1.1 SERVANT LEADERS FACILITATE
                                                                  Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.2.1.2 SERVANT LEADERS REMOVE ORGANIZATIONAL IMPEDIMENTS
                                                                  Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.2.1.3 SERVANT LEADERS PAVE THE WAY FOR OTHERS' CONTRIBUTION
                                                                  Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.2.1.4 CONSIDER THESE SERVANT LEADER RESPONSIBILITIES
                                                                  Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.2.2 ROLE OF THE PROJECT MANAGER IN AN AGILE ENVIRONMENT
                                                                  Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.2.3 PROJECT MANAGERS USE SERVANT LEADERSHIP
                                                                  Agile Project Management: Creating Innovative Products, Second Edition, Jim Highsmith, 2009, Leadership - Command and Control

                                                                      Question 18 of 50 Question ID: 506125203

                                                                      Two team members continue to have arguments and opposing views on an issue. As a project manager, you are becoming concerned that their disagreement could affect their other tasks. You understand the issue but have not intervened hoping they can resolve the issue between themselves.

                                                                      Which of the following is the most appropriate action to take?

                                                                      A
                                                                      B
                                                                      C
                                                                      D

                                                                      Correct Answer: A

                                                                      Explanation:

                                                                      The question should be read carefully to assess the situation being presented. Although the question states the two team members need to resolve the situation, the situation is not presented as critical, nor has the project manager attempted to facilitate a solution. When conflict arises, which becomes a negative factor or issue, the project team members are initially responsible for resolving the issue. If the team members fail to resolve their differences, it is the responsibility of the project manager to become involved and attempt to facilitate a solution. Using a force/direct approach, which involves pushing one's viewpoint at the expense of others results in a win-lose situation and may have a negative impact on the team if facilitation and compromise are not attempted first.



                                                                      Details for Each Option:

                                                                      A

                                                                      Correct. The question doesn't indicate the situation is critical or that the project manager has already attempted to facilitate a solution. When conflict arises, and the team members haven't been able to make progress themselves, it is the responsibility of the project manager to become involved and attempt to facilitate a solution.

                                                                      B

                                                                      Incorrect. The question doesn't indicate the situation is critical or that the project manager has attempted to facilitate a solution so at this point it would be premature for the project manager to force a decision or make the decision independent of a discussion between the two project members. Facilitating a discussion in the hope of coming to a solution that results in a compromise should be attempted first.

                                                                      C

                                                                      Incorrect. This is not a situation that requires the sponsor's input. It is an internal conflict within the team and is something that the project manager can address with the two team members. Also, the technical nature of the issue is not likely the domain of the sponsor.

                                                                      D

                                                                      Incorrect. As a project manager, you are expected to assess the situation and determine the best resolution. It is not responsible or appropriate to involve the stakeholders in such an issue or to be asked to intervene in the day-to-day decisions made on the project.

                                                                      Exam Content Outline:

                                                                      Domain: 1. People
                                                                      Task: 1.1 Manage conflict
                                                                      PM Approach: Predictive

                                                                      +Reference:

                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 2.3.3 FACILITATE AND SUPPORT
                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.2 CREATE A COLLABORATIVE PROJECT TEAM ENVIRONMENT
                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.4.4 Interpersonal Skills
                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.2.7.1 Conflict Model
                                                                      Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.6 Manage Team
                                                                      Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 10 Tools and Techniques
