                                                                                                                          Question 31 of 50 Question ID: 507000001

                                                                                                                          The development team completed 24 of the planned 28 story points for the sprint. During the sprint review, the customer approves the completed deliverables, but he admonishes the team as being lazy and incompetent for failing to complete the entire sprint backlog.

                                                                                                                          How should the scrum master respond?

                                                                                                                          A
                                                                                                                          B
                                                                                                                          C
                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                          Correct Answer: A

                                                                                                                          Explanation:

                                                                                                                          In this scenario, the customer has expressed their frustration with the development team's performance by referring to them as lazy and incompetent. The customer might be entitled to be disappointed and frustrated with the project team for failing to meet their commitment. However, it is never appropriate to be disrespectful of others. One of the project management principles for project leaders is to be a diligent, respectful, and caring steward. Integrity obligates project leaders to ensure that the project team members, and others, are treated with dignity and respect. It might be a difficult conversation, but the scrum master has an ethical obligation to challenge the customer to consider their words and actions to be empathetic and respectful of others.

                                                                                                                          Watch to see how Cornelius Fichtner explains the correct answer during a live webinar:

                                                                                                                          Please note that Cornelius focuses primarily on explaining the correct answer and not necessarily why the others are incorrect. Also note that on the technical side, the video will continue playing beyond the explanation, so you will have to click the video to stop it. To find more videos like this, please click here to visit our YouTube channel



                                                                                                                          Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                          A

                                                                                                                          Correct. The customer might be entitled to be disappointed and frustrated with the project team for failing to meet their commitment. However, as a steward, the scrum master has an obligation to challenge stakeholders (customers are project stakeholders) to consider their words and actions to be empathetic and respectful of others.

                                                                                                                          B

                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Discussing the reasons for the failed sprint as well as determining the root cause of the issue and actions to improve performance is one of the duties of the scrum master as a servant leader. However, the appropriate venue for this topic would be the sprint retrospective rather than the daily standup meeting.

                                                                                                                          C

                                                                                                                          Incorrect. The team might or might not have overcommitted during sprint planning. However, without first knowing the reason for the failed sprint, encouraging the team to commit to completing fewer story points for the next sprint would not be appropriate at this point. Finding the root cause of the performance gap would be a better choice.

                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Without knowing the reason for the shortfall, assuming that there was a lack of effort by the team is not aligned with the agile leadership practices. The scrum master should first seek to understand the root causes of the performance gap before addressing the problem. Besides, good leaders should respect team members' work-life balance.

                                                                                                                          Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                          Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                          Task: 1.9 Collaborate with stakeholders
                                                                                                                          PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                          +Reference:

                                                                                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.1 BE A DILIGENT, RESPECTFUL, AND CARING STEWARD
                                                                                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.4.4 Interpersonal Skills
                                                                                                                          Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 3.3 Qualities and Skills of a Leader
                                                                                                                          End Exam

                                                                                                                              Question 32 of 50 Question ID: 506112614

                                                                                                                              A servant leader has just been assigned to an upcoming product development project and believes that the project is well-suited to Kanban. However, the development team is unfamiliar with this approach.

                                                                                                                              What is the servant leader's best course of action?

                                                                                                                              A
                                                                                                                              B
                                                                                                                              C
                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                              Correct Answer: D

                                                                                                                              Explanation:

                                                                                                                              The scenario implies that the servant leader wants to use a project management approach with which the development team is unfamiliar. If the servant leader believes that the Kanban approach is the best methodology for the project, then the servant leader has the responsibility to ensure that the development team has the appropriate training to execute the project. Of the available options, conducting a Kanban workshop would be consistent with agile best practices and provide the development with the necessary tools to execute the project.



                                                                                                                              Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                              A

                                                                                                                              Incorrect. The daily standup is a timeboxed meeting in which the development team members each describe what they accomplished yesterday, what they plan to accomplish today, as well as any impediments with which they need assistance. Merely discussing Kanban at the daily standup meeting would not provide the team with a working knowledge of Kanban that would be sufficient to perform the project work.

                                                                                                                              B

                                                                                                                              Incorrect. A retrospective is a meeting that allows the team to learn about, improve, and adapt its process. An iteration retrospective would occur at the end of an iteration, while the development team needs to be trained on the Kanban method prior to the start of the first iteration.

                                                                                                                              C

                                                                                                                              Incorrect. While letting the team learn Kanban on their own is a plausible answer choice, the risk in this approach is that every team member may learn a different flavor of Kanban or interpret study materials differently. A better approach would be providing the team with centralized training where all team members attend the same class/workshop/seminar and learn the same tools and techniques.

                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                              Correct. The servant leader needs to ensure that the development team has all of the tools necessary to execute the project. If the servant leader believes that Kanban is the best methodology for the project, then the servant leader needs to provide the appropriate training for the development team.

                                                                                                                              Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                              Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                              Task: 1.5 Ensure team members/stakeholders are adequately trained
                                                                                                                              PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                              +Reference:

                                                                                                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.1 BE A DILIGENT, RESPECTFUL, AND CARING STEWARD
                                                                                                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.6 DEMONSTRATE LEADERSHIP BEHAVIORS
                                                                                                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.1 PROJECT TEAM MANAGEMENT AND LEADERSHIP
                                                                                                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.1.3 Common Aspects of Team Development
                                                                                                                              Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 3.3 PROJECT FACTORS THAT INFLUENCE TAILORING
                                                                                                                              Coaching Agile Teams: A Companion for ScrumMasters, Agile Coaches, and Project Managers in Transition, Lyssa Adkins, 2010, Coach as Teacher
                                                                                                                              End Exam

                                                                                                                                  Question 33 of 50 Question ID: 506113124

                                                                                                                                  A project manager is acquiring the team resources as specified in the resource management plan. A scrum master is preassigned to lead the design phase of the project, which will use a scrum framework. However, the scrum master's functional manager states that the scrum master's current project has been extended, and therefore the scrum master cannot be released.

                                                                                                                                  What should the project manager do next?

                                                                                                                                  A
                                                                                                                                  B
                                                                                                                                  C
                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                  Correct Answer: A

                                                                                                                                  Explanation:

                                                                                                                                  The question implies that the project manager is performing the Acquire Resources process for a hybrid project. Negotiation is among the tools and techniques associated with this process. Even though the critical resource was preassigned, the functional leader does have authority over the release of the scrum master in this case. Therefore, the project manager may still need to negotiate for release (or partial release) of the scrum master. Although not an ideal solution, having the scrum master support both projects on a part-time basis might be a viable alternative. Of the available options, only negotiating with the functional leader is within the scope of authority of a project manager. If the functional leader agrees to share the resource, the project manager can then submit a change request to revise the project management plan to reflect the arrangement. Note that another option would have been to escalate the issue to obtain the release of the resource, but that action was not offered as an answer choice.



                                                                                                                                  Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                  A

                                                                                                                                  Correct. Even though the critical resource was preassigned, the project manager may still need to negotiate for the scrum master's release (or partial release) from the other project.

                                                                                                                                  B

                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. In this scenario, the project might or might not need to be put on hold until the critical resource is available. However, putting the project on hold is a "knee-jerk reaction". There are other alternatives that could be considered before postponing the project. Another answer choice better addresses the question asked.

                                                                                                                                  C

                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. While granting a bonus based on specific criteria (such as working overtime, or achievements) sounds like a fair approach, assuming that the scrum master will work full-time on both projects concurrently is unreasonable. Working overtime for prolonged periods is not sustainable.

                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. Adopting a predictive framework for the design phase of the project would likely eliminate the need for a scrum master. However, it is reasonable to assume that scrum was chosen as the methodology for valid reasons. The project manager should make every attempt to execute the project as planned.

                                                                                                                                  Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                  Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                                  Task: 1.8 Negotiate project agreements
                                                                                                                                  PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                  +Reference:

                                                                                                                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 2.4.1 INTERNAL ENVIRONMENT
                                                                                                                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.3 EFFECTIVELY ENGAGE WITH STAKEHOLDERS
                                                                                                                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.4.4 Interpersonal Skills
                                                                                                                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.2.7.2 Negotiation
                                                                                                                                  Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, A3.2 SCRUM
                                                                                                                                  Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.4 Acquire Resources
                                                                                                                                  Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 10 Tools and Techniques
                                                                                                                                  Effective Project Management: Traditional, Agile, Extreme, Hybrid, 8th Edition, Robert K. Wysocki, 2019, Estimating Resource Requirements

                                                                                                                                      Question 34 of 50 Question ID: 506112047

                                                                                                                                      An agile team is working on their first project together. The objectives for the first iteration were missed, and there is significant dissension among the members of the development team. During the iteration retrospective, it is discovered that some team members are working odd hours and have been unavailable when needed.

                                                                                                                                      What might the agile coach have done differently to prevent this situation?

                                                                                                                                      A
                                                                                                                                      B
                                                                                                                                      C
                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                      Correct Answer: D

                                                                                                                                      Explanation:

                                                                                                                                      A social contract is also known as the team charter or the team's working agreements. Facilitating a meeting at the start of the project to establish the team's working agreements will be critically important for a team that has not worked together previously. The team's working agreements are created and agreed upon by the project team. The team charter will document how the team will work together and set standards of behavior for things such as core hours. Had the agile coach facilitated a meeting to create a social contract, the issues described by the question might have been avoided, and this action is consistent with agile best practices.



                                                                                                                                      Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                      A

                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. Agile teams are self-organizing, and agile coaches should avoid mandating how the team goes about their work. The only exception would be some constraint that requires certain working hours, but no such constraints were described by the scenario.

                                                                                                                                      B

                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. Asking the functional leader to intervene upon initial discovery of the issue described in the question is a premature action. Additionally, asking the functional leader to intervene would be a reactive solution, whereas the question is asking what may have 'prevented' the situation from occurring in the first place.

                                                                                                                                      C

                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. There are various tools and techniques that can be used by project leaders to successfully manage and lead their teams. Saying that nothing could have prevented the situation is unlikely to be the correct answer choice.

                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                      Correct. The team charter (also known as a social contract) will establish standards of behavior for things such as core working hours. Had the agile coach facilitated a meeting to establish a social contract, the issues described by the question might have been avoided.

                                                                                                                                      Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                      Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                                      Task: 1.12 Define team ground rules
                                                                                                                                      PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                      +Reference:

                                                                                                                                      Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 5.1 CHARTER THE PROJECT AND THE TEAM
                                                                                                                                      The Software Project Manager's Bridge to Agility, Michele Sliger, Stacia Broderick, 2008, Team Working Agreements
                                                                                                                                      End Exam

                                                                                                                                          Question 35 of 50 Question ID: 507000030

                                                                                                                                          The scrum master sees that a team member has been missing the standup meetings. As a result, there has been poor coordination of daily activities and a negative impact on project performance. When confronted, the team member states that his functional manager has been asking him to complete critical tasks outside the project.

                                                                                                                                          What should the scrum master do?

                                                                                                                                          A
                                                                                                                                          B
                                                                                                                                          C
                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                          Correct Answer: B

                                                                                                                                          Explanation:

                                                                                                                                          Project leaders often need to recognize, evaluate, and respond to system interactions. When interdependencies exist, the project will impact and be impacted by other systems, and systems thinking will be important in maximizing the delivery of value for the organization. Ideally, project team members are fully dedicated to the project, but, in some cases, this might be unrealistic. Project team members often have responsibilities outside of the project, particularly within a matrix organizational structure, as is suggested in this scenario. The scrum master might not be able to prevent the project team member from completing critical tasks outside of the project. However, the scrum master has to try to negotiate with the functional manager the timing of the work so the team member can attend important meetings, such as the daily scrums, and complete project tasks.



                                                                                                                                          Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                          A

                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. The team charter sets standards of conduct for the project team members, likely including attendance at team meetings. However, in the scenario, the team member has been directed to complete other work by his functional manager. Thus, the team charter is not the root cause of the issue and would not help resolve it, even if revised.

                                                                                                                                          B

                                                                                                                                          Correct. Projects do not exist in isolation. Interdependencies often exist with other projects or work. In the scenario, the team member is being directed by his manager to complete other work, which negatively impacts the current project. The best option for the scrum master in this scenario is collaborating with the functional manager to mitigate the conflict.

                                                                                                                                          C

                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Agile teams are self-managing. Generally speaking, an agile leader should allow the team to resolve issues independently. However, some problems, like the one described in the scenario, are beyond the team's control. In such cases, stepping in to help resolve the issue for the team is the best course of action for the agile leader.

                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. While backlog prioritization is indeed the product owner's responsibility, taking this action just because one of the team members cannot complete their tasks (for whatever reason) would be unwarranted. Besides, in the context of the scenario, 'escalating' the issue of attendance to the product owner makes little sense.

                                                                                                                                          Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                          Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                                          Task: 1.8 Negotiate project agreements
                                                                                                                                          PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                          +Reference:

                                                                                                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.5 RECOGNIZE, EVALUATE, AND RESPOND TO SYSTEM INTERACTIONS
                                                                                                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.2.7.2 Negotiation
                                                                                                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.4.3 MEETINGS AND EVENTS
                                                                                                                                          Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.6 Manage Team
                                                                                                                                          Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 10 Tools and Techniques

                                                                                                                                              Question 36 of 50 Question ID: 507000033

                                                                                                                                              For the last few iterations, a stakeholder has been approaching the scrum master with a suggestion to modify the way the team carries out its development work. According to the stakeholder, the change will save time without affecting the project backlog.

                                                                                                                                              What action should be taken by the scrum master?

                                                                                                                                              A
                                                                                                                                              B
                                                                                                                                              C
                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                              Correct Answer: A

                                                                                                                                              Explanation:

                                                                                                                                              Demonstrating leadership behaviors is one of the core project management principles. Delegating authority when appropriate is an example of what a successful leader can do to empower the project team and achieve project goals. The scenario suggests that the project is utilizing an agile framework. Agile teams are encouraged to be self-managing, self-directing, and empowered to make decisions concerning the way they carry out their work. For example, the determination of how the work will be accomplished and by whom is made by the project team members without the need to involve heavy processes or bureaucratic procedures. However, it's the scrum master's duty as a servant leader to listen to the stakeholder's suggestion and facilitate a discussion on the topic with the team while, at the same time, allowing the team to make the final decision as to whether to adopt the new approach or keep using the current one.



                                                                                                                                              Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                              A

                                                                                                                                              Correct. Successful agile teams are self-managing, self-directing, and empowered to make decisions concerning their work. As such, determining the best approach for how to carry out their work is made by the team members. The scrum master might help facilitate a discussion on the topic, but it's up to the team to make the final decision.

                                                                                                                                              B

                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. In predictive projects, a change that affects any of the baselines (even if the change may improve the project schedule, as suggested by the scenario) would require an approved change request. An agile project, like the one described in the scenario, uses lighter processes and would not require a change request to make modifications.

                                                                                                                                              C

                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. Shielding the team from distractions is one of the scrum master's responsibilities as a servant leader. However, this leadership behavior should not be taken to the extreme. Not all interruptions are harmful. Balancing the needs of the project, team, and stakeholders is a better approach. Rejecting the suggestion, especially if it can improve project performance, would be an overreaction.

                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. Discussing the suggested change with the team is the right approach. However, using the daily standup meeting as a venue for this discussion is inappropriate. The daily standup is a timeboxed agile event focused on three specific agenda items. Improvement suggestions are not part of them and are better to be discussed at retrospectives.

                                                                                                                                              Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                              Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                                              Task: 1.2 Lead a team
                                                                                                                                              PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                              +Reference:

                                                                                                                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.6 DEMONSTRATE LEADERSHIP BEHAVIORS
                                                                                                                                              Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 4.3.1 AGILE TEAMS
                                                                                                                                              End Exam

                                                                                                                                                  Question 37 of 50 Question ID: 506112659

                                                                                                                                                  During a sprint retrospective, the team members complain that the business analyst has been unresponsive to clarify the work package to be developed in the sprint. As a result, the work package has not been accepted by the customer. The scrum master reaches out to the business analyst and requests them to collaborate with the team during the upcoming sprints.

                                                                                                                                                  What else should the scrum master do?

                                                                                                                                                  A
                                                                                                                                                  B
                                                                                                                                                  C
                                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                                  Correct Answer: C

                                                                                                                                                  Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                  If a business analyst is assigned to a project, requirement-related activities are the responsibility of that role. On agile projects, this role is frequently performed by a product owner. The product owner serves as the voice of the customer and needs to work closely with the development team to ensure that the team's efforts remain in alignment with project goals. The lack of involvement from a business analyst/product owner can lead to slower development and rework. Although the scrum master has reached out to the business analyst and requested them to work with the team in the upcoming sprints, this does not mean that the issue will not recur. An effective leader should identify potential problems and address them proactively. Since the business analyst's lack of involvement has been identified as an issue, the scrum master should continue to monitor the business analyst's involvement to ensure that the project work can continue without disruption.

                                                                                                                                                  Note, the scenario describes a project in which the project scope is managed using the traditional/predictive project management approach (e.g., work package) while the work is carried out using the Scrum framework (sprints). This means the project as a whole is managed in a hybrid way. While this information does not change the correct answer, it is important to understand that projects can be managed using various approaches, including predictive (sometimes called traditional or waterfall), agile (Scrum, Kanban, etc.), or hybrid which is a combination of both.



                                                                                                                                                  Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                  A

                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. It is unclear if the problem has been resolved. All the scrum master did was reaching out to the business analyst and requesting them to collaborate with the team during the upcoming sprints. The problem will be considered resolved only when it's evident the business analyst is available for the team when needed.

                                                                                                                                                  B

                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. It is not uncommon that an organization may have resource constraints resulting in some of the resources being unavailable and, consequently, unresponsive at times. An individual being unavailable and/or unresponsive, though, is unlikely to be considered as one who violates work ethics.

                                                                                                                                                  C

                                                                                                                                                  Correct. Even though it appears that the current issue has been addressed, a good proactive leader is expected to continue monitoring issues to ensure they do not reoccur going forward.

                                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. Since the customer has not accepted the work package, it is reasonable to assume that the package will have to be modified to meet customer needs. However, before a modification to a work package can be made, a clarification on what exactly to fix should be provided by the business analyst, who, according to the scenario, has not been available.

                                                                                                                                                  Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                                                  Task: 1.7 Address and remove impediments, obstacles, and blockers for the team
                                                                                                                                                  PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.4 FOCUS ON VALUE

                                                                                                                                                      Question 38 of 50 Question ID: 506112901

                                                                                                                                                      You have just taken over a project in the middle of the fourth of five phases. The project is running behind schedule which is attributed to poor performance of the project team. You want to improve their performance and avoid repeating past mistakes.

                                                                                                                                                      What should you do first?

                                                                                                                                                      A
                                                                                                                                                      B
                                                                                                                                                      C
                                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                                      Correct Answer: B

                                                                                                                                                      Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                      The question implies that you are about to carry out the Develop Team process. Since you are new to the project, it is best to familiarize yourself with any knowledge gained thus far in the project concerning team development. The lessons learned register is a project document used to record knowledge gained during a project so that it can be used to improve performance in the current project and entered into the lessons learned repository. The best source for understanding what has not worked well thus far in the project, so the mistakes are not repeated, is the lessons learned register. Note that you should also review the lessons learned repository in addition to the lessons learned register, to understand what has been effective and ineffective for past projects, but the lessons learned repository was not listed as an answer choice. Therefore, of the available options, examining the lessons learned register to avoid repeating past mistakes is the best answer to the question asked.



                                                                                                                                                      Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                      A

                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. Project team assignments is a document that may help the project manager identify the team members and their roles and responsibilities. However, this information is unlikely to help the project manager improve the team member performance and avoid repeating past mistakes.

                                                                                                                                                      B

                                                                                                                                                      Correct. The lessons learned register is a project document used to record knowledge gained during a project so that it can be used to improve performance. The lessons learned register is the best source to learn about mistakes made earlier in the project.

                                                                                                                                                      C

                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. The team charter is a document that records the team values, agreements, and operating guidelines, as well as establishing clear expectations regarding acceptable behavior by project team members. The team charter does not have information that may help identify issues that caused poor team performance.

                                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. Seeking feedback from the project team is a good idea. However, first, this information may be biased as it reflects only the point of view of the team members; second, you, as the project manager, will be better prepared for the upcoming discussions by first reviewing the lessons learned from earlier in the project, thus saving time and helping guide the sessions for greater productivity.

                                                                                                                                                      Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                                      Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                                                      Task: 1.6 Build a team
                                                                                                                                                      PM Approach: Predictive

                                                                                                                                                      +Reference:

                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.2 CREATE A COLLABORATIVE PROJECT TEAM ENVIRONMENT
                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.3 HIGH-PERFORMING PROJECT TEAMS
                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.7.6 GROWING AND IMPROVING
                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 3.4.3.4 Implement Ongoing Improvement
                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.6.2 LOGS AND REGISTERS

                                                                                                                                                          Question 39 of 50 Question ID: 506113722

                                                                                                                                                          In order to take advantage of the best talent available, a project manager recruits developers internationally rather than just locally. She is delighted to have acquired such highly skilled individuals but now needs to develop them into a cohesive team. Ideally, the project manager would like to bring everyone together at the home office, but the project budget does not allow for travel expenses.

                                                                                                                                                          What is the best tool or technique for the project manager to use in this situation?

                                                                                                                                                          A
                                                                                                                                                          B
                                                                                                                                                          C
                                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                                          Correct Answer: C

                                                                                                                                                          Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                          The question suggests that the Develop Team process is being performed, and virtual teams is a tool that may be used during this process. A virtual team can use technology to create an online team environment to build team cohesion. In this way, the project manager can take advantage of a broader pool of candidates without paying travel expenses. The use of a virtual team is the best tool that the project manager can use under the circumstances provided in the question.



                                                                                                                                                          Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                          A

                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Sensitivity analysis is an analysis technique to determine which individual project risks have the most potential impact on project outcomes. The question is asking about building team cohesion and not project risks.

                                                                                                                                                          B

                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Recognition and rewards can be helpful in team development by recognizing and rewarding desirable behavior. However, recognition and rewards are not the best tools for building team cohesion.

                                                                                                                                                          C

                                                                                                                                                          Correct. A virtual team can use technology to create an online team environment to build team cohesion. In this way, the project manager can take advantage of a broader pool of candidates without paying travel expenses.

                                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Colocation involves placing the project team members in the same physical location to enhance their ability to perform as a team. Although this may be the best way to build team cohesion, the question states that budget constraints prohibit this option.

                                                                                                                                                              Question 40 of 50 Question ID: 506113725

                                                                                                                                                              The project is behind schedule. A team member thinks activity A needs more resources, while another wants the resources added to activity B. A third team member suggests a compromise by adding resources to both activities and recovering a week from each. The project manager ends the discussion and makes the unilateral decision to run activities D and E in parallel instead of sequentially.

                                                                                                                                                              Which conflict management technique is the project manager using to resolve the issue?

                                                                                                                                                              A
                                                                                                                                                              B
                                                                                                                                                              C
                                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                                              Correct Answer: A

                                                                                                                                                              Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                              The PMBOK® Guide describes five techniques for conflict management. These techniques include withdraw/avoid, smooth/accommodate, compromise/reconcile, force/direct, and collaboration/problem solve. In this scenario, the project manager used a position of power to enforce a decision in order to resolve the conflict. Pushing one’s viewpoint at the expense of others is known as a force/direct approach. Note, force/direct conflict resolution technique is typically used to resolve an emergency. There is not enough information in the question to determine if the two weeks delay is considered an emergency. However, among the choices given, force/direct is the best answer to the question asked as it accurately describes the action taken by the project manager.



                                                                                                                                                              Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                              A

                                                                                                                                                              Correct. Force/direct is a conflict management technique defined by pushing one’s viewpoint at the expense of others. It is usually enforced through a position of power to resolve a conflict.

                                                                                                                                                              B

                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. In this scenario, a compromise was suggested, but the project manager made the decision from a position of power.

                                                                                                                                                              C

                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. Crashing is a schedule compression technique which adds resources to an activity on the critical path. However, this is not a conflict management technique.

                                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. Fast tracking is a schedule compression technique where an activity is run in parallel instead of sequentially. However, this is not a conflict management technique.

                                                                                                                                                              Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                                              Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                                                              Task: 1.1 Manage conflict
                                                                                                                                                              PM Approach: Predictive

                                                                                                                                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.2 CREATE A COLLABORATIVE PROJECT TEAM ENVIRONMENT

                                                                                                                                                                  Question 41 of 50 Question ID: 506112983

                                                                                                                                                                  As a project manager, you are in the process of estimating the team resources that will be required for your project. The challenge you are having is that, due to the nature of the project and the selected development approach, only a few of the top levels of the WBS have been identified with the remainder to be progressively elaborated throughout the project.

                                                                                                                                                                  What is the best approach to determine the team resource requirements for the project?

                                                                                                                                                                  A
                                                                                                                                                                  B
                                                                                                                                                                  C
                                                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                                                  Correct Answer: A

                                                                                                                                                                  Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                  The question suggests that you, as the project manager, are performing the Estimate Activity Resources process and that a hybrid development approach is being utilized. When incorporating agile practices within an overarching traditional waterfall approach, the project scope may be progressively elaborated throughout the project, and the work breakdown structure (WBS) may not be fully decomposed during initial project planning. Under such circumstances, one viable approach to estimating team resource requirements would be to utilize the analogous estimating technique. If there are past similar projects, the organizational process assets (OPAs) should contain detailed information that could be used for analogous estimating.



                                                                                                                                                                  Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                  A

                                                                                                                                                                  Correct. Analogous estimating can be used when the work breakdown structure (WBS) cannot be fully decomposed. In this case, the organizational process assets (OPAs) may contain information on similar past projects that can be used as a basis for estimating team resource requirements.

                                                                                                                                                                  B

                                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. With the bottom-up approach, team resources would be estimated at the activity level and then aggregated to develop estimates from work packages up to the project level. However, at this point, you are not able to fully decompose the WBS in order to identify the activities and work packages. The bottom-up estimating technique requires a fully decomposed WBS.

                                                                                                                                                                  C

                                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. The work package represents the lowest level of the work breakdown structure (WBS). In this scenario, only the highest levels of the WBS exist, which would not include the work package level. Therefore, in this scenario, one would not be able to apply parametric estimating to individual work packages.

                                                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. With a traditional waterfall project, the work breakdown structure (WBS) would be fully decomposed down to the work package level during the Create WBS process. When incorporating agile techniques, the project scope may be progressively elaborated as the project progresses rather than fully decomposed during initial project planning. In this scenario, the question stipulates that the WBS will be progressively elaborated throughout the project rather than fully decomposed as part of initial project planning.

                                                                                                                                                                  Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                                                  Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                                                                  Task: 1.6 Build a team
                                                                                                                                                                  PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.8.2 AMBIGUITY

                                                                                                                                                                  Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 9 Inputs and Outputs
