                                                                                                                                                                      Question 42 of 50 Question ID: 506113139

                                                                                                                                                                      A project manager facilitates a discussion with the team about experimenting with some agile practices in their plan-driven project. A team member familiar with agile suggests incorporating daily standups and is willing to help the project manager and the rest of the team with the implementation of this practice.

                                                                                                                                                                      How can the team members best prepare for their first daily standup meeting?

                                                                                                                                                                      A
                                                                                                                                                                      B
                                                                                                                                                                      C
                                                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                                                      Correct Answer: A

                                                                                                                                                                      Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                      Burndown charts are powerful information radiators used to reflect the team’s progress towards their goals and objectives. In hybrid managed projects, like the one described in the scenario, the team members can use the burndown charts to track their progress. To provide an accurate picture of the team’s progress towards the iteration’s goal (assuming the work is done in iterations), the burndown chart should be updated regularly. Ideally, the burndown chart reflects the team’s daily progress towards their commitments. Updating their progress prior to the daily standup meetings enables the team to collectively see their progress and inform their decisions as to what needs their attention and what to work on next. Whether using software tools to automatically update the burndown chart or manually updating the burndown chart, the responsibility within the team is for all to update in a timely fashion.



                                                                                                                                                                      Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                      A

                                                                                                                                                                      Correct. Burndown charts track the work that remains to be completed (typically in the iteration backlog). The data can be used to aid the project team members in organizing their efforts between daily standup meetings. This information is most relevant when team members update the progress daily or even more frequently if needed.

                                                                                                                                                                      B

                                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. Reporting is part of hybrid managed projects, such as the one described in the scenario. However, a report to the product owner (if one is even assigned to the project) is not the responsibility of the team prior to every daily standup. An up-to-date burndown chart can present information to the product owner if he or she chooses to review it.

                                                                                                                                                                      C

                                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. With plan-driven projects, work items are estimated as part of the dedicated planning processes. With agile projects, work items are estimated prior to or as part of iteration planning meetings. Estimating work items daily before the daily standup meeting is unlikely to be a reasonable approach.

                                                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. The approach to repair defects depends on the project management methodology selected for the project. However, even in agile or hybrid projects, where plans and work are more dynamic than in predictive projects, expecting the team to resolve any defects found during the previous day before the beginning of a daily standup is unrealistic.

                                                                                                                                                                      Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                                                      Domain: 2. Process
                                                                                                                                                                      Task: 2.16 Ensure knowledge transfer for project continuity
                                                                                                                                                                      PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                                                      +Reference:

                                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.7.3.2 Information Radiators
                                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.7.3.3 Visual Controls
                                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.4.3 MEETINGS AND EVENTS
                                                                                                                                                                      Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 5.2.4 DAILY STANDUPS
                                                                                                                                                                      Agile Practice Guide - First Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, 5.4.1 AGILE TEAMS MEASURE RESULTS
                                                                                                                                                                      Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.1 Direct and Manage Project Work
                                                                                                                                                                      Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 7.5 Control Schedule
                                                                                                                                                                      Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 10 Tools and Techniques

                                                                                                                                                                          Question 43 of 50 Question ID: 506112887

                                                                                                                                                                          To manage its workflow, an agile team is using a Kanban board. The agile coach notices that WIP limits have been recently violated, causing delays in tasks' completion. To expedite work across the board, the coach suggests that the team reinstates the WIP limits and collaborate on the tasks.

                                                                                                                                                                          Which of the following collaboration techniques will the team least likely apply to implement the coach's suggestion?

                                                                                                                                                                          A
                                                                                                                                                                          B
                                                                                                                                                                          C
                                                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                                                          Correct Answer: C

                                                                                                                                                                          Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                          The nature of Kanban encourages teams to focus on lead time, throughput, and continuous flow of value. Agile teams are self-organizing, self-managing, and empowered to make decisions related to their work. When team performance slows down, the team can apply various collaboration techniques (such as pairing, swarming, and mobbing) to get back on track. These techniques are aimed to quickly produce a small number of features across the Kanban board, thus expediting the work and increasing the overall throughput. Collaboration is possible thanks to the fact that the team members are generalizing specialists, which means they have both a specialty plus a breadth of experience across multiple skills, rather than a single specialization. Agile team members work to develop such characteristics due to intense collaboration and self-organization that allow them to pair, swarm, and mob, eventually getting work done quickly and efficiently. Reducing WIP limits, as suggested by the agile coach in the scenario, encourages pairing, swarming, and mobbing to resolve problems and expedite work. Of the choices provided, pairing, swarming, and mobbing are valid terms that represent collaboration techniques. While jamming is a legitimate word used in various connotations, the term "jamming" is not associated with agile project management. Since the question is asking to select the 'least' likely approach to implement the agile coach's suggestion to collaborate, jamming is the best answer.



                                                                                                                                                                          Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                          A

                                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. In software development, pairing refers to pair programming, an agile technique in which two team members develop software code together as a pair. Since pairing is an example of a collaborative technique, and the question is looking for the 'least' collaborative approach, this choice can be eliminated.

                                                                                                                                                                          B

                                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Swarming is an example of a collaboration technique in which multiple team members focus collectively on resolving a specific task, issue, impediment, etc. The question is asking for the 'least' likely collaborative approach. Since swarming is an example of collaboration, this choice represents an incorrect answer.

                                                                                                                                                                          C

                                                                                                                                                                          Correct. While jamming is a legitimate word used in various connotations, the term "jamming" is not associated with agile project management. As far as project management is concerned, "jamming" is a made-up term. Since the question is requesting to select the 'least' likely collaborative approach, this choice is considered the correct answer.

                                                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Mobbing is a collaborative technique in which multiple team members focus simultaneously and coordinate their contributions on a particular work item. The question is asking for the 'least' likely collaborative approach. Since mobbing is an example of collaboration, this choice represents an incorrect answer.

                                                                                                                                                                              Question 44 of 50 Question ID: 506113580

                                                                                                                                                                              An agile coach wants to ensure that expectations between him and the team members are properly set. The coach meets with the team and emphasizes that he will adhere to the servant leadership approach while working with the team members.

                                                                                                                                                                              What should the team expect the least from the agile coach?

                                                                                                                                                                              A
                                                                                                                                                                              B
                                                                                                                                                                              C
                                                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                                                              Correct Answer: D

                                                                                                                                                                              Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                              Agile approaches emphasize servant leadership as a way to empower teams. Servant leadership is the practice of leading through service to the team, by focusing on understanding and addressing the needs of team members in order to enable the highest possible team performance. The role of the agile coach as a servant leader is to facilitate the team's discovery and definition of agile. Servant leaders practice and radiate agile. Servant leaders focus on purpose, people, and process. Providing feedback on the product increment developed by the team, however, is the responsibility of the product owner, not an agile coach. Since the question is asking about what to expect the 'least' from the agile coach, providing feedback on the product increment developed by the team is the best answer to the question asked.



                                                                                                                                                                              Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                              A

                                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. Agile leaders work with the team to define the purpose of the project and the roles of the team members in the project so that they can engage and coalesce around the project goal. The entire team optimizes at the project level, not the person level.

                                                                                                                                                                              B

                                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. Once the purpose of the project is established, agile leaders encourage the team to create an environment where everyone can succeed. An agile coach would ask each team member to contribute across the project work.

                                                                                                                                                                              C

                                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. While following a "perfect" agile process is a noble goal, focusing on the product, or the final result of the project is more important. "Working software is the primary measure of progress," states one of the Agile Manifesto principles. This does not mean, however, that the process should be abandoned. Agile teams hold periodic retrospectives to improve the process.

                                                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                                                              Correct. This answer choice describes a sprint review. It's the customer or product owner (or their proxies) rather than the agile coach who is ultimately responsible for providing feedback to the team on the product increment developed during the sprint. Hence, providing feedback is what the team should expect the 'least' from the agile coach, making this choice the best answer to the question asked.

                                                                                                                                                                              Task: 1.2 Lead a team
                                                                                                                                                                              PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 2.3.3 FACILITATE AND SUPPORT
                                                                                                                                                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.3.3 DEVELOPMENT APPROACHES

                                                                                                                                                                                  Question 45 of 50 Question ID: 506112786

                                                                                                                                                                                  You are leading a project team that will consist of a mixture of internal employees and contractors, and you have decided to use a chart that will ensure the assignment of roles and responsibilities is clear. The table has a list of activities as well as an indication of which team member is accountable, responsible, providing consultation, or is an information resource for the activity.

                                                                                                                                                                                  Which of the following choices describe this chart?

                                                                                                                                                                                  A
                                                                                                                                                                                  B
                                                                                                                                                                                  C
                                                                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                                                                  Correct Answer: A

                                                                                                                                                                                  Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                                  The RAM is a tool used during Plan Resource Management to illustrate the connections between work packages and project team members. The matrix format shows all activities associated with one person and all people associated with one activity ensuring there is only one person accountable for any one task. By using a RAM, the project manager can avoid confusion about who has authority for the work. The scenario describes a RACI (responsible, accountable, consult, inform) chart which is an example of a RAM. The RACI chart shows the activities to be completed and designates the resources assigned to each activity as either responsible, accountable, consult, or inform. Using a RACI chart can ensure the assignment of roles and responsibilities are understood. Since the RACI chart is an example of a RAM, and the RACI chart was not an answer choice, RAM is the best answer to this question.



                                                                                                                                                                                  Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                                  A

                                                                                                                                                                                  Correct. A RAM shows the project resources assigned to each activity and is used to illustrate the connections between activities and project team members. The scenario describes a RACI (responsible, accountable, consult, inform) chart which is a tool used to ensure the assignment of roles and responsibilities is clear. Since a RACI chart is an example of a RAM, this choice is the best answer to the question asked.

                                                                                                                                                                                  B

                                                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. Control charts are used to plot measurements gathered during the Control Quality process to determine the stability of a process. In this scenario, you are using a chart to display project team member's roles and responsibilities which is a tool used in the Plan Resource Management process, not the Control Quality process.

                                                                                                                                                                                  C

                                                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. The resource histogram is a bar chart that provides a visual representation of the number of hours a person, department, or the entire project team will be needed each week or month over the course of the project. The focus of the resource histogram is only on the staff hours required, not roles, responsibilities, or activities; therefore, this choice is an incorrect answer.

                                                                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. The resource breakdown structure is a hierarchical list of team and physical resources related by category and resource type. Used in conjunction with the WBS, the resource breakdown structure allows the work to be planned, monitored and controlled. The RACI chart, described in the scenario, assigns responsibilities to specific team members whereas the resource breakdown structure uses resource types. Therefore, the resource breakdown structure is not the chart described in the scenario.

                                                                                                                                                                                  Task: 1.4 Empower team members and stakeholders
                                                                                                                                                                                  PM Approach: Predictive

                                                                                                                                                                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.4 PLANNING PERFORMANCE DOMAIN
                                                                                                                                                                                  A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.6.6 VISUAL DATA AND INFORMATION
                                                                                                                                                                                  Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 5.15 Plan Resource Management
                                                                                                                                                                                  Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 10 Tools and Techniques

                                                                                                                                                                                      Question 46 of 50 Question ID: 506151464

                                                                                                                                                                                      An agile leader facilitates a retrospective, where team members angrily blame each other for violating working agreements.

                                                                                                                                                                                      What should the agile leader do first?

                                                                                                                                                                                      A
                                                                                                                                                                                      B
                                                                                                                                                                                      C
                                                                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                                                                      Correct Answer: C

                                                                                                                                                                                      Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                                      The Oxford dictionary defines emotional intelligence as "the capacity to be aware of, control, and express one's emotions, and to handle interpersonal relationships judiciously and empathetically". In this case, the agile leader has to be very emotionally intelligent in handling the situation. Derby and Larsen, in their book on agile retrospectives, suggest, "creating a structured way for people to talk about feelings makes it more comfortable to raise topics that have an emotional charge." As a facilitator, the agile leader is in charge of group dynamics, and that includes handling emotional interactions. Emotions are part of human interaction, but some emotional displays can be disruptive to the retrospective goals. Ultimately, a person is in charge of his or her own individual emotions, so the agile leader must keep theirs in check while facilitating in order to keep the session productive. As a facilitator, the agile leader should neither ignore individual emotions nor try to make everyone at the retrospective happy.



                                                                                                                                                                                      Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                                      A

                                                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. Ignoring the situation and letting the team members continue to argue with each other angrily is unlikely to result in a positive outcome; neither would ignoring allow the agile leader to continue the retrospective as planned. An agile leader should deal with these emotions in a way that is helpful and constructive.

                                                                                                                                                                                      B

                                                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. Different people deal with their feelings differently, so they may be guarded or get even more emotional when asked to discuss their feelings openly and directly, especially when the atmosphere at the meeting is already heated. The agile leader should consider other techniques to elicit discussion on emotionally charged topics better.

                                                                                                                                                                                      C

                                                                                                                                                                                      Correct. Keeping his or her own emotional state and responses in check is the first thing for the agile leader to do in the scenario described. Being aware of their own personal emotions would allow the agile leader to thoughtfully analyze the situation and decide on the best course of action rather than respond with a "knee-jerk" reaction.

                                                                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. While the first thing for the agile leader to do in the scenario described could be trying to calm the arguing team members down, making everyone in the retrospective happy is not the goal of a retrospective, nor is it the agile leader's role.

                                                                                                                                                                                      Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                                                                      Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                                                                                      Task: 1.14 Promote team performance through the application of emotional intelligence
                                                                                                                                                                                      PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                                                                      +Reference:

                                                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.4.4 Interpersonal Skills
                                                                                                                                                                                      Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.6 Manage Team
                                                                                                                                                                                      Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 10 Tools and Techniques
                                                                                                                                                                                      Agile Retrospectives Making Good Teams Great, Esther Derby, Diana Larsen, 2006, Emotional Intelligence
                                                                                                                                                                                      Additional resources: https://www.project-management-prepcast.com/free/pmp-exam/articles/882-emotional-intelligence-and-project-management2
                                                                                                                                                                                      Additional resources: https://www.pmi.org/learning/library/emotional-intelligence-improve-project-performance-1019

                                                                                                                                                                                          Question 47 of 50 Question ID: 506113818

                                                                                                                                                                                          A new scrum master joins an agile team that is been through its fifth iteration. The scrum master notices that the level of trust in the team is low, the team members are guarded, and conflict often arises within the team. As a result, team performance suffers.

                                                                                                                                                                                          What is the best course of action for the scrum master to help resolve conflict within the team?

                                                                                                                                                                                          A
                                                                                                                                                                                          B
                                                                                                                                                                                          C
                                                                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                                                                          Correct Answer: C

                                                                                                                                                                                          Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                                          An adult or assertive, rather than a submissive, style helps with setting the scene for conflict resolution. To resolve a conflict, the scrum master should focus on the issue at hand. The scrum master should communicate well by actively listening where it helps to restate and rephrase problems when communicating with the team. The scrum master has to be able to deal with situations. At times, when conflict can reach an impasse or emotions run high, a scrum master may recommend a break to allow members some time to cool down or to step away from the issue. This break (not a disengagement from work) may prevent further intensifying of the conflict and may allow time for other solutions to resolve conflict to present themselves.



                                                                                                                                                                                          Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                                          A

                                                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. The existence of a conflict is not necessarily attributed to people. Focusing on people rather than on issues may cause the people to become defensive and eventually close. Focusing on issues rather than individuals may help open a dialogue leading to a potential conflict resolution.

                                                                                                                                                                                          B

                                                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. An iteration retrospective meeting is an agile event to reflect on and adapt the process used by the team to develop the product. While theoretically having a human resources representative at the retrospective meeting may be a good idea, this course of action should not come first. The scrum master, as a servant leader, should first try to attempt to resolve the conflict on his/her own.

                                                                                                                                                                                          C

                                                                                                                                                                                          Correct. Being assertive rather than submissive means acting decisively with confidence, but not aggression. Good agile leaders know how to be proactive rather than passive. Listening and analytical skills are crucial in understanding the conflict and finding the best way to resolve it.

                                                                                                                                                                                          D

                                                                                                                                                                                          Incorrect. Team members can be difficult, but that is not an excuse to have them disengage from their work due to unresolved conflict. Disengaging does not necessarily follow from recognizing that people can just be 'difficult'.

                                                                                                                                                                                          Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                                                                          Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                                                                                          Task: 1.1 Manage conflict
                                                                                                                                                                                          PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 2.3.3 FACILITATE AND SUPPORT
                                                                                                                                                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.2 CREATE A COLLABORATIVE PROJECT TEAM ENVIRONMENT
                                                                                                                                                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.4.4 Interpersonal Skills
                                                                                                                                                                                          A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.2.7.1 Conflict Model
                                                                                                                                                                                          Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.6 Manage Team

                                                                                                                                                                                              Question 48 of 50 Question ID: 506110023

                                                                                                                                                                                              After checking the internal resources, the project manager realizes that the company does not have developers who are experienced in the programming language required for the project.

                                                                                                                                                                                              What should the project manager do next?

                                                                                                                                                                                              A
                                                                                                                                                                                              B
                                                                                                                                                                                              C
                                                                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                                                                              Correct Answer: D

                                                                                                                                                                                              Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                                              The question implies that the project manager is performing the Acquire Resources process. The resources needed for the project can be internal or external to the project-performing organization. However, in the scenario described by the question, the performing organization lacks developers experienced with the required programming language. Therefore, of the choices provided, the logical action for the project manager is to acquire the resources from outside the organization.



                                                                                                                                                                                              Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                                              A

                                                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. The use of a virtual team opens up new possibilities when acquiring project team members by forming a team of people from the same organization who are located in broad geographic areas. However, the question states that the company does not have any developers internally with experience in the required programming language. Therefore, regardless of whether the team is collocated or virtual, using internal resources will not resolve the problem described in the question.

                                                                                                                                                                                              B

                                                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. Terminating the project just because the company lacks the internal resources to complete the project work is an over-reaction. The project manager may consider acquiring the resources externally. Therefore, this answer choice can be eliminated.

                                                                                                                                                                                              C

                                                                                                                                                                                              Incorrect. There are many tools and techniques available at the disposition of the project manager to acquire resources. Seeking help from or escalating the issue to the project sponsor is a premature action.

                                                                                                                                                                                              D

                                                                                                                                                                                              Correct. The resources needed for the project can be internal or external to the project-performing organization. When the performing organization lacks the resources necessary to perform project work, the resource can be acquired externally, typically through the procurement processes.

                                                                                                                                                                                              Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                                                                              Domain: 2. Process
                                                                                                                                                                                              Task: 2.5 Plan and manage budget and resources
                                                                                                                                                                                              PM Approach: Predictive

                                                                                                                                                                                              +Reference:

                                                                                                                                                                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.4.5 PHYSICAL RESOURCES
                                                                                                                                                                                              A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 4.6.3 PLANS
                                                                                                                                                                                              Process Groups: A Practice Guide, Project Management Institute Inc., 2023, 6.4 Acquire Resources

                                                                                                                                                                                                  Question 49 of 50 Question ID: 506112837

                                                                                                                                                                                                  A company has always utilized a predictive approach to project management, but now the project management office wants to incorporate some agile best practices to generate earlier revenue realization. The project manager is about to begin planning for the new project and is concerned that the project team is not equipped to work in a hybrid environment.

                                                                                                                                                                                                  What is the project manager's best course of action?

                                                                                                                                                                                                  A
                                                                                                                                                                                                  B
                                                                                                                                                                                                  C
                                                                                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                                                                                  Correct Answer: B

                                                                                                                                                                                                  Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                                                  In the scenario, the project management office (PMO) is driving a transition to agile by using a hybrid project management approach where some agile best practices are incorporated into an existing predictive framework. Since the PMO is driving this change, it is reasonable to assume that they have done some planning on how to bring the project team(s) up to speed with agile best practices. Additionally, one of the typical responsibilities of the PMO is to provide project management training. In this case, the PMO may lack the internal resources to provide such training. Still, they should be able to secure external resources as needed to ensure a successful transition to a hybrid model. At the very least, the PMO should be able to provide some guidance on how to obtain the needed training.



                                                                                                                                                                                                  Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                                                  A

                                                                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. While it's true that agile teams are self-organizing and empowered to make decisions related to their work, the scenario describes an organization that has never attempted agile/hybrid projects before and the team that is not equipped to work in a hybrid environment. Therefore, empowering the team would unlikely to bring the desired results.

                                                                                                                                                                                                  B

                                                                                                                                                                                                  Correct. The PMO will typically provide project managers with resources to improve productivity. In this case, the PMO may or may not have internal resources with the necessary knowledge to provide agile training. However, the PMO should be able to provide guidance and external resources, if needed, to train the project team on agile best practices.

                                                                                                                                                                                                  C

                                                                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. Embarking on a new project management approach does represent a project risk, and this risk should be accounted for in the risk register. However, the question is asking about the best course of action with regard to the missing skills. Merely documenting the risk in the risk register would not resolve the problem.

                                                                                                                                                                                                  D

                                                                                                                                                                                                  Incorrect. The lessons learned repository should contain knowledge gained from past projects. However, the scenario stipulates that the performing organization has only utilized predictive project management. Therefore, it is unlikely that there will be any relevant information regarding agile best practices in the lessons learned repository.

                                                                                                                                                                                                  Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                                                                                  Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                                                                                                  Task: 1.5 Ensure team members/stakeholders are adequately trained
                                                                                                                                                                                                  PM Approach: Agile / Hybrid

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Question 50 of 50 Question ID: 506112798

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Your project team functions as a well-organized unit. The team members are interdependent and work through issues smoothly and effectively.

                                                                                                                                                                                                      What is your best course of action?

                                                                                                                                                                                                      A
                                                                                                                                                                                                      B
                                                                                                                                                                                                      C
                                                                                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Correct Answer: D

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Explanation:

                                                                                                                                                                                                      The question is in reference to the Tuckman ladder, which is one of the models used to describe team development. This model includes five stages of development that teams may go through including forming, storming, norming, performing, and adjourning. The question suggests that the project team had reached the performing stage of team development. Teams that reach the performing stage function as a well-organized unit, and the team members are interdependent and work through issues smoothly and effectively. This makes the life of project managers relatively easy and requires from them to mostly serve as a gateway between the project team and the stakeholders and delegate decision making to the team members.



                                                                                                                                                                                                      Details for Each Option:

                                                                                                                                                                                                      A

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. This answer choice describes the role of the project manager when the team is in the forming stage of their development. During the forming stage, the project team members meet and learn about the project and their formal roles and responsibilities. The project manager should provide clear direction on the project objectives and the behavior expected from the team members.

                                                                                                                                                                                                      B

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. This answer choice represents the role of the project manager when the team is in the storming stage of team development. During this phase, the team begins to address the project work, technical decision, and the project management approach. If the team members are not collaborative or open to differing ideas and perspectives, the environment can become counterproductive. The team needs help from the project manager to get through their struggle, listen to each other, and understand their differences.

                                                                                                                                                                                                      C

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Incorrect. This answer choice describes the role of the project manager when the team is in the norming stage of their development. During the norming stage, the team members begin to work together and adjust their work habits and behaviors to support the team. The team members begin to trust each other. In this phase, the best course of action for the project manager is to ensure the team resolves conflicts quickly and continues to work collaboratively. The project manager will step in only when needed.

                                                                                                                                                                                                      D

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Correct. This answer choice describes the role of the project manager when the team reaches its performing stage when they function as a well-organized unit, and the team members are interdependent and work through issues smoothly and effectively. This is the ideal stage of team development that requires from the project manager to be a gateway between the project team and the stakeholders and delegate decision making to the team members.

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Exam Content Outline:

                                                                                                                                                                                                      Domain: 1. People
                                                                                                                                                                                                      Task: 1.2 Lead a team
                                                                                                                                                                                                      PM Approach: Predictive

                                                                                                                                                                                                      +Reference:

                                                                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.2 CREATE A COLLABORATIVE PROJECT TEAM ENVIRONMENT
                                                                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, The Standard for Project Management: 3.6 DEMONSTRATE LEADERSHIP BEHAVIORS
                                                                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.1 PROJECT TEAM MANAGEMENT AND LEADERSHIP
                                                                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.1.2 Distributed Management and Leadership
                                                                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.2 PROJECT TEAM CULTURE
                                                                                                                                                                                                      A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) – Seventh Edition, Project Management Institute Inc., 2021, 2.2.3 HIGH-PERFORMING PROJECT TEAMS
